name: swiped
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
swipe
swipe verb
(HIT)
[ I or T, usually + adv/prep ] to hit or try to hit something, especially with a sideways movement: She opened the window and swiped at the flies with a rolled-up newspaper to make them go out.UK She swiped him round the head.mainly US The car swiped the side of the garage as he pulled out. See also
sideswipe verb

swipe verb
(STEAL)
[ T ] informal to steal: Okay, who swiped my keys?

swipe verb
(MOVE)
[ T ] to move a card containing information stored on a magnetic strip through a device that reads this information
[ I or T ] to move your finger over the screen of a mobile phone or tablet in order to move onto the next page, choose something, etc.: Swipe left to see more search results.
